body: please read the contribution guidelines ;)
https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/contributing.md

### expected behaviour
tell us what should happen

site requests should take less time to complete. 


### actual behaviour
tell us what happens instead

response time is very slow. latency for all requests is longer than acceptable – 3 sec+

### steps to reproduce

i’m a newbie – to repro, you’ll need to log in to www.schoenimages.com/lightbox.  i’m reluctant to post the password for public consumption.  please advise: reply to johnschoen@gmail.com

### server configuration








operating system:  linux 

web server: hostmonster

hosting package	monsterpower
hostname	host279.hostmonster.com
cpanel version	11.32.6 (build 3)
theme	hostmonster
apache version	2.2.23
php version	5.4.12
mysql version	5.5.30-log
architecture	x86_64
operating system	linux
shared ip address	74.220.215.79
path to sendmail	/usr/sbin/sendmail
path to perl	/usr/bin/perl
kernel version	2.6.32-20130307.60.9.bh6

database:

php version: 5.4.12

owncloud version:  5.0

### client configuration

browser: chrome  version 26.0.1410.64 m

operating system:

windows 7 ultimate  service pack 1    64-bit
system:   amd fx – 8120 8-core   3.1 ghz

please change your hoster, youve got 16mb of ram available ;)

owncloud doesnt run on that.

thanks!

when troubleshooting with hoster tech support.

thanks

[31-mar-2013 21:13:16 utc] php fatal error:  allowed memory size of 134217728 bytes exhausted

divide by 8*1024*1024 and you get 16mb

edit: oh, i see its not bits but bytes, :) should be 16*8mb then which is 128mb. but yeah, upgrade to 512mb
great: thanks

ok: the root domain is getting access to 128mb of memory. is there some way to troubleshoot in the oc subdirectory where memory is getting clipped? is there a memory config setting somewhere in oc instance?
see my edit above ;)
sorry - new to this - r u saying hoster is the issue? does oc need to sit on the root domain to work properly? why would root domain's 128mb memory not be available to oc on a subdomain?
what i mean is: you need more than 128mb memory

see: http://www.schoenimages.com/lightbox/info.php 

showing 128mb avail to the subdomain.
how much more memory?
not sure, try 512mb.
ok tnx
try it locally in a vm maybe and check how much rum you need to avoid those memory error messages

b4 moving hosts, i'd like to figure out why the subdomain has access to 128mb and oc err log is showing it's running out at 16mb. 

there must be clipping going on within oc somewhere.
https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/2880#issuecomment-16337589
ah - c it now. tnx
